history.text: Hello there! Are you looking for a movie recommendation?
Have you seen the Great Gatsby from 2013?
I have! I absolutely loved it - I love most Baz Luhrmann movies! I especially loved Leo as Gatsby.
Tobey Maguire is also in it.
I have not seen it yet.
Yes - and Carey Mulligan as Daisy was about perfect. Joel Edgerton as Tom was also really great - they had some great casting.
It isn't your typical literary movie though. It is very dramatic and showy, with lots of color and opulance.
Rotten Tomatoes only gives the film a 48
Which I thought was a little low, but overall CinemaScore is a B, which is probably about right.
The movie had a 190 million budget.
Which is massive - that's a lot of money for a movie, but I suppose since it was shot in Australia, it cost a little more.
Would you watch it again?
I love the story of Gatsby, though - he is the American tragedy.
Absolutely. The movie is more of an experience than a movie - especially when you watch the party scenes. They are so over the top and extravagant.
It takes place during the Roaring Twenties

In New York! Which was a very happening place to
 be during that time period.
You make me want to watch it.
It is very fun - there's scandal and affairs and secrets and lies.
Would you call it a romantic drama?
I would, but I would also consider it a tragedy, ultimately. Gatsby absolutely loves Daisy and would do anything for her.
But Daisy is fickle and will do what is best for her own survival.
F Scott Fitzgerald was a good writer.
Yes! So many twists and turns, with Gatsby taking the blame for things he didn't do, lying about his background - all sorts of things!
Gatsby was a millionare  when that was a lot of money
Exactly, but it is so tragic that the only thing he ever wanted was Daisy.
And then, because he covers for her, there is a case of mistaken identity, and he is killed.
Yeah sad story
And the worst part is that Daisy, the woman he loved, doesn't even bother to come to his funeral!! After everything he did for her. It is just the worst.
Daisy is an interesting character
She's pretty much a horrible person, but she is charming and beautiful, so it is easy to see why Gatsby loved her.
Nick was the only person to attend Gatsby's funeral
Because he was Gatsby's only true friend.
The reviews make it sound like it's all style and no substance
That is probably fair. It tells the story but with Baz Luhrmann, it is all about how things look and how you experience them.
That is his directing style - so this movie is very stylish and opulent and over the top
How was Joel Edgerton
He was fantastic as Tom. It was really fun to watch him!
Yes, this version is very different from past adaptions.
Definitely!
I hope you think about watching it - remember it's not about the story, it's about the experience - and that's really what hooks you.
I will definitely think about it. You make the film sound better than my preconceptions
Well I am glad to help and hope you enjoy it!
Thanks for the fun conversation
Goodbye
You too! Goodbye!
